alert.note: Alert for Bland; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 11:16AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms with heavy rainfall to persist across eastern Tazewell and western Bland counties through NOON EDT... At 1111 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms that had developed and persisted across eastern Tazewell and western Bland counties during the past hour. The storms with heavy rainfall extended from just north of Tazewell to just south of Bluefield VA to Kimberling and were moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Heavy Rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall could result in minor flooding of poor drainage and low-lying areas. Visibility will be greatly reduced in areas of heavy rainfall. Locations impacted include... Bland... Bluefield... Tazewell... Rocky Gap... Bastian... Burkes Garden... and Mechanicsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
